intro: Paesia acclivis, commonly known as the mountain bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. Paesia acclivis is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in alpine gardens.
